body_html:
It's hard to efficiently check an error condition coming off the GPU, so instead we just fill with a 0. Many ops do this. The int32 version of the op runs on CPU for historical reasons.
…
On Fri, Oct 13, 2017, 10:34 AM Reed ***@***.***> wrote: Note that the int32 version is running on the CPU, since there is no int32 GPU scatter_nd kernel. So it seems the exception is raised iff the op is on the CPU. @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo> do you know why this is issue is occurring? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#13687 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim5NA4YhCnVpF521HMsvn3C4ntesAks5sr58rgaJpZM4P4ZTQ> .
body_text:
It's hard to efficiently check an error condition coming off the GPU, so
instead we just fill with a 0.  Many ops do this.  The int32 version of the
op runs on CPU for historical reasons.
…
On Fri, Oct 13, 2017, 10:34 AM Reed ***@***.***> wrote:
 Note that the int32 version is running on the CPU, since there is no int32
 GPU scatter_nd kernel. So it seems the exception is raised iff the op is
 on the CPU.

 @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo> do you know why this is issue is
 occurring?

 —

body:
It's hard to efficiently check an error condition coming off the GPU, so
instead we just fill with a 0.  Many ops do this.  The int32 version of the
op runs on CPU for historical reasons.

On Fri, Oct 13, 2017, 10:34 AM Reed <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Note that the int32 version is running on the CPU, since there is no int32
> GPU scatter_nd kernel. So it seems the exception is raised iff the op is
> on the CPU.
>
> @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo> do you know why this is issue is
> occurring?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
